result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- Sign up for Probation on 07/18/22 by 03:00PM.
- 2 days credit against ultimate sentence.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

3:44 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson.  Attorney Michelle P Brekken in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jens Hubert Loberg in court for Jason Michael Grutt. Defendant Jason Michael Grutt in court. Court reviews case. recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count 1: Strangulation and Suffocation WITH enhancer-940.235(1)  and enters 2 year DJOC and AMENDED Count 3: Battery WITH enhancer- 940.19(1). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty and with holds sentence for a period of 2 years in Count 1. Court finds Defendant guilty in Count 3. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses Count 2. Sentencing arguments. Victim makes statement. 

Court Orders:

Count 1: 2 year DJOC

Count 3: W/S 2 Years Probation

- 200 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- Restitution: $760.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation. Payable to K.M.W.
- DNA Sample
- AODA assessment within 30 days and follow through with recommendations
- Complete Domestic Abuse Assessment within 30 days and follow through with recommendations 
- Complete Psychological Evaluation and follow through with recommendations 
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- No Contact with K.M.W.
- Comply with terms and conditions in 22CF127 Count 1 DJOC
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation on 07/18/22 by 03:00 PM 

Restitution is held open for 60 days

Status conference on March 2, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

- Def may retrieve belongings in the presence of law enforcement. 

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, K. M.W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
